message: As new senators are sworn in for the 115th Congress, I look forward to keeping up the fight for progress for Washington state and our country. I will continue working to create an economy that helps strengthens the Middle Class, to provide affordable, high-quality health care, to make our nation more secure and energy independent, to protect workers and consumers, to foster innovation for tomorrow and to ensure we educate students with the skills to succeed. I will also stand up to anyone who threatens our shared values and attempts to legislate bigotry or hate. Together, we can achieve progress and strengthen our great nation.

Speaker Ryan and the GOP are playing politics with women's health. I stand with Planned Parenthood and the critical healthcare they provide to more than 100,000 women & families across Washington. Like and share to join me in fighting for a woman’s full access to healthcare.

I’ve introduced legislation that would protect Washington, Oregon, and California coasts from offshore drilling. Our West Coast supports thousands of jobs from fisheries, trade, tourism and recreation—which could all be devastated by an oil spill. We must permanently ban offshore drilling on the West Coast to protect our coastal communities, economies, and ecosystems against the risk of an oil spill and make investments in clean energy alternatives to help meet America’s energy needs.

Today, I called on Republicans to end efforts to repeal the Affordable Care Act that would take health care away from more than 750,000 Washingtonians and 20 million Americans, and put it in the hands of special interests and Wall Street. Repealing the ACA is stealing healthcare from hardworking Americans, and I urge my colleagues to turn that down. It is important that we do not repeal the Affordable Care Act without any idea what we are replacing it with.

In Science Magazine President Obama makes the business case for investing in clean energy technologies. We’ve already seen investments in clean energy technologies by business leaders like Bill Gates and Jeff Bezos spearheading the development and innovation of technologies that will deliver reliable, affordable, clean energy to consumers. Walking away from future investments in clean energy would hurt one of our best chances to innovative solutions to today’s climate challenges.

I was proud to help the Washington Apple Health (Medicaid) program and the federal government come to an agreement to approve a Medicaid Waiver that allows Washington to test new and innovative approaches to keeping people healthy, reducing unnecessary hospital and nursing home stays, and driving down costs to taxpayers. A great step towards a healthier Washington state!
This fight is not over. I will do all I can to protect the gains we’ve made in the Affordable Care Act.

The trend of hate and intolerance we have seen at the Islamic Center of the Eastside in Bellevue is deeply disturbing and does not reflect the core values of our state. In Washington state we uphold the belief that injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere, and actions that threaten the safety of our minority communities threaten the safety of us all. We must fight injustice and condemn hate crimes against our fellow Americans.

Today, Dr. King’s vision endures and his dream lives on. We celebrate the life of an American civil rights leader who led a nation to confront injustice, stand against discrimination and open doors of opportunity. The power of his words and strength of his leadership remain a source of guidance as we work to ensure the rights of all Americans are protected.

Information on labor violations by companies owned, chaired, or substantially managed by Trump nominees must be public so Congress and the American people can adequately evaluate their suitability. That is why I’ve joined U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren and other Senate Democrats asking the U.S. Department of Labor to fulfill the Center for American Progress' FOIA request for any information related to past or ongoing investigations by the DOL.

Yesterday I pressed President-Elect Trump’s nominee to be Secretary of the Interior, Rep. Ryan Zinke for his commitment to preserve our public lands, protect our natural resources and work to minimize environmental harm as we are faced with the growing dangers of climate change.
Thank you President Obama, you have honored our nation with your service. For 8 years you have courageously fought for the justice and equality of all Americans.

Today, we stand together in numbers too great to ignore to send a strong message to the new administration. We reject the violent words and actions we have witnessed against women, immigrants, people of color and marginalized communities. We will fight, and not stop until women’s rights, human rights, equality and justice are achieved.

On the 44th anniversary of Roe v. Wade, reproductive rights face an uncertain future. Attacks on women’s health by those in the new administration are well documented, and include denying access to contraception and abortion. It has never been more important that we double down on our commitment to protect access to safe, affordable health care and reproductive freedom.
NA

President Trump’s choice to head the Federal Communications Commission opposes strong Net Neutrality rules that protect an open internet and support millions of jobs in the robust internet economy. This is disappointing, and contradicts his campaign pledges to grow the economy, protect and create new jobs. Erasing Net Neutrality rules would put everyday internet users and small business owners at a disadvantage. All Americans deserve equal access to an open Internet.
We need a commitment to protect and strengthen Medicaid – not attack it. A war on Medicaid is not the answer.

Our infrastructure is crumbling and old. That’s why I joined U.S. Senate Democrats in introducing a plan to rebuild America’s crumbling roads, bridges and ports, updated our energy infrastructure, expand broadband in rural communities, modernize VA hospitals and rebuild public schools. A $1 trillion dollar infrastructure investment would produce 15 million new jobs, save consumers money and help our businesses compete.
#TBT to one of my favorite moments at the Seattle Womxn's March. Our young people are the future, and the ones we must inspire to keep marching.

Public education boosts millions out of poverty and gives every student a chance to succeed. Yet Betsy DeVos misses the importance of public schools to working families. When it came to protecting students with disabilities, Mrs. DeVos showed a lack of understanding for federal disability laws in education that ensure every child receives a high-quality education. We need a Secretary of Education who will move public education forward and ensure all children are getting the best education possible. I will be voting NO on Mrs. DeVos’ nomination.

President Trump’s recent gag order to all federal agencies to silence communications with the public and members of Congress promotes a culture of fear among federal employees, and prevents them from serving the American public. The American people expect an open, transparent and honest government, and this recent directive is contrary to that expectation. http://www.bainbridgereview.com/news/cantwell-joins-fellow-senators-in-call-on-trump-to-pull-back-gag-order/

President Trump’s recent gag order to all federal agencies to silence communications with the public and members of Congress promotes a culture of fear among federal employees, and prevents them from serving the American public. The American people expect an open, transparent and honest government, and this recent directive is contrary to that expectation.

The executive order on immigration flies in the face of core American values and is hurting U.S. interests. As a country, we can find better ways to strengthen security through increased information sharing, law enforcement cooperation and the use of biometrics and technology.  We are a country that treats everyone equally under the law and that believes in due process. We do not discriminate based on national origin or religion. The executive order is likely unconstitutional and should be challenged in federal courts.  Our state has a proud tradition of resettling refugees from all over the world including Cambodia, Vietnam, and Somalia. We have a stronger economy and more dynamic high-tech workforce thanks to diversity. Likewise, the U.S. benefits from immigration. Our country must continue to do its part to help Syrian refugees who are suffering the worst humanitarian crisis since World War II, as well as others fleeing from persecution.

Tonight I took this photo while standing with my colleagues and fellow Americans to demand President Trump rescind his discriminatory executive orders. We are a nation of immigrants, and have always been a refuge from persecution. I refuse to let injustice define us. These executive orders betray our core values and disrespect our nation. Together we will fight to end this executive order, lift the ban and restore justice and equality.

Yesterday, I co-sponsored two bills to block President Trump’s discriminatory and harmful ban on refugees and immigrants from certain Muslim-majority countries. These bills would ensure President Trump’s executive orders do not go into effect. Unfortunately, yesterday Republicans lacked the courage to allow us to have a vote on our legislation. But we will continue this fight.

I have concerns that as U.S. Attorney General and our country’s chief law enforcement officer, Senator Sessions will not protect Americans’ civil rights. In the past, Senator Sessions blocked efforts to safeguard voting rights, to protect women from domestic violence, and to expand LGBTQ rights. He opposed a woman’s right to choose and called Roe v. Wade a “colossal” mistake. He opposed sentencing and immigration reforms. His testimony on states legalizing and regulating marijuana left questions about the Trump administration’s approach to these issues.   Given his record, I am concerned that if Senator Sessions is confirmed to be U.S. Attorney General, he and the Trump administration may not uphold current protections for all Americans. Therefore, I will be voting “NO” on Senator Sessions’ confirmation.

Today, I joined my fellow Senate Finance Committee Democrats to boycott the vote on Steve Mnuchin for Treasury and Rep. Tom Price for Health and Human Services. These two nominees will have tremendous responsibility for our economic and financial security and the health and safety of hundreds of millions of Americans. Our committee has critically important questions that remain outstanding and they must be addressed. With so much at stake, the American people deserve answers.

Thank you to everyone who has contacted me and made your voice heard. We are continuing to receive an unprecedented level of engagement from constituents and I appreciate your taking the time to share your views. If you get a busy signal, please keep calling. I take your input seriously as I consider the important decisions ahead. Remember you can always contact me with your questions and concerns through my website. Follow me here and on Twitter to stay updated on the issues and my work in the Senate on behalf of Washingtonians.

This administration just started a War on Clean Water. Yesterday the Senate voted to repeal the Stream Protection Rule that protects communities, fish and environmental regions whose water is endangered by pollution from coal mining. Reversing this regulation isn’t good for jobs or for the economy. Advocating for pollution as an economic solution won’t work.

I introduced legislation earlier this week to get rid of this discriminatory ban. Now, we're another step closer. Thanks to AG Ferguson and all who stand up against discrimination and intolerance. The fight continues.

I was proud to help break ground on Sea-Tac Airport’s North Terminal expansion, adding eight gates and new amenities for passengers. Seattle-Tacoma International Airport (Sea-Tac) is one of the fastest growing airports in the nation and we must keep making these critical investments in our infrastructure to accommodate our growing economy.

In a letter to President Trump I made clear my strong opposition to his decision to approve the Dakota Access Pipeline and bypass tribal consultation, environmental law, and due process. This blatant disregard for federal law, our environment, and our country’s treaty and trust responsibilities to Native American tribes is unacceptable. Despite yesterday’s devastating decision, I met with Standing Rock Sioux Chairman Dave Archambault II and assured him that I will stand with Standing Rock, and fight.
Today, I'm on the Senate Floor to oppose the nomination of Rep. Tom Price to be the Health and Human Services Secretary.

To my Republican colleagues who continue to demand U.S. Senate Democrats step aside and usher through Trump Administration nominees with completely insufficient information, I say this. There are a record number of billionaires in this cabinet, many with deeply concerning conflicts of interest. The conflicts are there. We want them cleared up.

I am glad the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals thinks Washington state got it right. Thanks to the Washington State Attorney General Bob Ferguson, Washington state businesses and all involved in the U.S. District Court case, these important Constitutional issues will be addressed. And in the meantime, travel will continue and families can be reunited.

There are many reasons why I don't support Steve Mnuchin's nomination to Treasury Secretary. At the height of the financial crisis, Mnuchin and his bank, OneWest, booked billions of dollars in profits on the backs of foreclosure victims. Mr. Mnuchin preyed on seniors and homeowners in trouble with unethical and illegal foreclosure practices, including right here in Washington state. We need a Treasury Secretary who learned from the financial crisis, not one who profited off of it.

Finding an affordable place to live should not mean having to win the lottery. But last month, when a new 108 unit affordable apartment building in South Seattle received over 2,000 applications from students, seniors and young families desperate to find affordable housing, it did. That’s why I will continue to push for passage of my bipartisan legislation to expand the Low Income Housing Tax Credit to help address the affordable housing crisis that affects the health and mobility of our communities.

A growing number of you are right to be deeply concerned with the Republican effort to repeal the Affordable Care Act and wage a war on Medicaid.  As Republicans scramble to come up with a plan, new data show that because of the ACA the uninsured rate has hit an all-time low.  In Washington state fewer than 6 percent are uninsured – a 60 percent drop. Despite what Republicans say, I know your coverage is important and thousands of you have told me what losing it could mean.

This situation is serious. I have joined my colleagues in calling for an in-depth investigation that must go beyond General Flynn himself, and look into all contact with Russian Intelligence officers and government officials. There must be an investigation into what happened during the campaign with Russian interference in our election. It should also look into whether anyone at the White House covered up any ongoing illegal activity.

I took the Senate floor late last night to voice my opposition to the nomination of Scott Pruitt for EPA administrator. This is a fight for the health and livelihood of our planet and all people. We are only here for a short period of time to choose the world we will pass on to future generations. So let’s choose right.

This weekend commemorates the 75th anniversary of the detainment of more than 120,000 Japanese Americans forced into internment camps during World War II. The first to be evacuated came from Bainbridge Island in Washington state. We must never forget this terrible chapter in our country's past, to ensure it never happens again. We honor the strength of those sent to these camps, and recognize the sacrifices so many were forced to make. I’m proud to have worked to establish the Bainbridge Island Japanese American Exclusion Memorial to help tell this important story in our nation's history to future generations.

With so many major issues facing our nation, it is deeply troubling that this administration is intent on rolling back the clock on inclusive policies for students and schools. The impact of bullying and division in schools has been well documented. This latest action by the Administration shows no regard for the safety and well-being of trans students, and I will join my colleagues in fighting to keep us moving towards a more inclusive and safe environment for students, teachers and families.

Washingtonians want access to more affordable prescription drugs from Canada. Under this legislation's new and stringent drug safety requirements, Americans will have more choice and affordability. This legislation also includes important new penalties to crack down on the illegal importation of opioids and other illicit drugs.

The threats at the Mercer Island Jewish Community Center, the acts of vandalism in Ballard, and desecration of Jewish graves across the country are deeply disturbing. I condemn these acts of hate and join those supporting our Jewish Communities and all of our religious communities. We must continue to fight injustice in all of its forms.

I was proud to have CEO and Co-founder of MomsRising.org, Kristin Rowe-Finkbeiner, as my guest at last night’s Joint Address. President Trump’s call for ‘flexibility’ sounds a lot like the Paul Ryan plan on Medicaid. Capping Medicaid would take health care from millions, kill jobs and local economies, shutter hospitals and clinics, and shift billions of dollars in costs to states and local governments. We need to continue innovating in health care to drive better care at lower cost – not cut, cap, and block grant Medicaid. I will continue fighting to protect health care access and bring costs down for working Washingtonians and for all Americans.
I won’t stop standing up for our values.

Washington state’s economy depends on a healthy Puget Sound. From struggling salmon fisheries, declining orca populations, and massive shellfish die-offs from ocean acidification – slashing Puget Sound recovery funding at EPA and NOAA show a blatant disregard for our environment. A failure to confront the environmental challenges the Sound faces will have disastrous consequences for our economy.

House Republicans’ plan to repeal the Affordable Care Act and cut Medicaid is literally a war on Medicaid. Millions of people would lose coverage and be severely affected by such a cut. We need to work together to expand ACA innovation in Medicaid and bring down health insurance costs for all Americans.

Women have made great strides in achieving equal opportunity from boardrooms to the Halls of Congress and everywhere in between. This progress has been hard-won and hard-fought. Today on International Women's Day, we celebrate our progress and acknowledge that we must continue to push boundaries, face our challenges and keep moving forward.

This week Girl Scouts celebrate their 105th birthday! For over a century, Girl Scouts has inspired millions of girls to lead and has encouraged them to become the innovators, risk-takers and responsible leaders our world needs. Like to wish the Girl Scouts another 105 years of connecting girls to a world of possibility.

Republicans’ bill to repeal the Affordable Care Act continues their war on Medicaid. According to the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office, the bill cuts $880 billion from Medicaid and the states in the first ten years alone, taking health care away from 14 million Americans. We should be helping states innovate in Medicaid to save costs and improve care, as Washington state is doing – not cutting, capping, and cost-shifting.

There appear to have been unprecedented conflicts of interest that pose a threat to American national security and the integrity of the government of the United States. We must have an in-depth investigation to uncover what happened during the campaign with Russian interference in our election, and look into whether anyone at the White House covered up any ongoing illegal activity.

We must prohibit inhumane methods of killing bears and wolves within the 16 national wildlife refuges in Alaska, while allowing hunting in humane ways. I will continue to fight to protect fish and wildlife populations critical to our biodiversity and Pacific Northwest ecosystem.

Three years ago today a devastating landslide hit the community of Oso, Washington, tragically claiming 43 lives and causing millions of dollars in damages. I’ve introduced a bill that will help communities prepare and respond to landslides and other natural hazards, which is critical to protecting lives and preventing tragedies from future disasters. #OsoStrong

Republicans are stealing Medicaid coverage from the American people, and instead hiding in the repeal of the Affordable Care Act – nothing more than a budget mechanism to cut Americans off of Medicaid. This truly is a heist.

Today the American people sent a clear message: We are not willing to risk the health of this nation. The fight for affordable, accessible and high-quality health care is far from over, but today your voices were heard.

President Trump’s new budget blueprint confirms fears that this Administration will not adequately support scientific research and innovation. His budget does not show an understanding of science’s role in national and domestic security, in protecting air and water and other resources and in preventing disease and lowering the cost of health care. I hope that—as we move forward—many of my colleagues will work very hard to speak out against the policies of this administration that are coming into conflict with science.

President Trump’s executive order today marks an irresponsible retreat from making polluters pay, promoting energy efficiency, growing our clean energy economy and addressing the threat of climate change. The Trump Administration is sabotaging the United States’ chances of becoming the world’s clean energy superpower in order to line the pockets of polluters. I will oppose this wrong-headed order with every tool at my disposal and I urge him to rescind it immediately.

Americans made their voices heard last week and rejected the Republican plan to repeal the Affordable Care Act and cap Medicaid. Now it’s time for President Trump to abandon efforts to repeal the Affordable Care Act and work with Democrats to improve the law and lower the cost of health care for all Americans.

I take very seriously the solemn responsibility of the Senate to provide advice and consent on nominations to our federal courts. If confirmed, Judge Gorsuch will have a lifetime appointment to the U.S. Supreme Court, and his impact on the lives of all Americans cannot be overstated. Many difficult issues will come before the court in the months and years ahead. We need a U.S. Supreme Court justice who will stand up for equal justice for all. I still have questions and concerns about Judge Gorsuch. Therefore, I cannot support cloture and will not support the confirmation of Judge Neil Gorsuch to serve on the U.S. Supreme Court.

Continuing their partisan political crusade Senate Republicans voted today to make it easier for states to discriminate against health care providers like Planned Parenthood, who provide critical family planning services. Once again, Republicans don’t seem to understand that a successful health care strategy is a successful economic strategy for Americans.

The growing number of hate-related crimes and threats of violence against Americans of various religious and racial minorities in our country is alarming. Action must be taken in the face of growing hate violence. I urge President Trump to establish a Presidential Task Force on preventing and combating hate violence in order to begin an important national dialogue on how best to counter hate.

They couldn’t get enough support for their bill taking away health care from 24 million people. Now they’re reportedly trying to get rid of pre-existing conditions, making their bad deal even worse for Americans. The fight to preserve the protections of the ACA continues.

Today Republicans abandoned tradition and long-standing Senate rules – possibly causing irreparable damage to our American political process. Last night, I voiced my opposition to this power grab and the nomination of Neil Gorsuch to be our next Supreme Court Justice. I have great concern over the impact his lifetime appointment to the U.S. Supreme Court will have on the lives of Americans.

It has been clear for 60 years that separating commercial and investment banking would protect consumers from having to pay for the debts of bad financial practices of Wall Street.   That’s why I’ve re-introduced the bipartisan 21st Century Glass-Steagall Act with Senators Elizabeth Warren, John McCain and Angus King to reduce risk for the American taxpayer in our financial system and decrease the likelihood of future financial crises.   Supported even by President Donald Trump, Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin, and National Economic Council Director Gary Cohn, it’s time to reinstate this sharp bright line. American's have suffered enough from big banks making them their deep pockets for reckless behavior.

I am deeply concerned and believe the United States must uphold its trust and treaty obligations to the Standing Rock Sioux and other tribes affected by the Dakota Access Pipeline and respect the self-determination and wishes of all tribal nations. By ‘expediting’ the DAPL process and proceeding without appropriate consultation and consideration for the tribes’ wishes, the United States is turning its back on its most solemn responsibilities.

During President Trump’s address to Congress in February, he pledged to ‘promote clean air and water.’ Yet, such a pledge is meaningless when it’s followed with a proposed 31% cut to the EPA’s budget. These cuts would significantly harm communities by reducing clean air and clean water grants, cutting enforcement against polluters, and entirely eliminating efforts to combat climate change and the cleanup of major regional bodies of water, including Puget Sound. I urge him to oppose these drastic and dangerous cuts.

It is hard to believe that some combination of better planning, training, communication, or additional incentives would not have mitigated this incident or avoided it altogether. Travelers already face long lines, steep fees and packed planes – we need to make air travel more consumer-friendly.

President Trump must honor his promise to be a great steward of our public lands so that our children and grandchildren can experience them with the same wonder we do today. Failing to preserve these precious areas would threaten the cultural, historical and biological wealth of our country.

This is exactly the kind of broader dialogue we need on a national level to stop the rise in hate and violence, improve security, and save lives. I’ve called on President Trump to establish a Presidential Task force to make preventing and combating the growing number of hate-related crimes a national priority.

Today kicks off National Park Week to celebrate our national parks, the most spectacular part of our national heritage! In Washington state, we are hikers, bikers, anglers, climbers, skiers and much more because of the recreational spaces that have been preserved in some of America’s most beautiful national parks. Our national parks, forests and public lands improve our quality of life and provide us important economic and cultural opportunities. #FindYourPark

National Park Week serves to remind us of the awesome beauty & adventure our open spaces & wild places afford us – and what it could mean to lose them. The management and exploitation of our public lands for profit without regard for the environmental and public health consequences for Americans is reckless and wrong.

Climate change is happening – the question is how fast. Our communities, clean air & water, national parks, infrastructure and economy are at risk. We need to do the work now so we're prepared for our future, not propose – as President Trump has done – a 31% cut to the EPA budget entirely eliminating our efforts to combat climate change.

Yesterday, I visited a 50-unit low-income housing project in Everett WA, my latest stop to build support for expanding the Low-Income Housing Tax Credit (LIHTC). It was great talking with local housing officials, advocates and tenants to discuss the critical need for affordable housing in a roundtable discussion and what more can be done to address the affordable housing crisis.

I am proud to have re-introduced the 21st Century Glass-Steagall Act. Glass-Steagall worked for 60 years, separating commercial and investment banking to protect consumers from having to pay for the debts of bad financial practices of Wall Street. We need to put it back to work.

It is unfortunate that this National Park Week, a week we should be celebrating American conservation and our nation’s treasured parks, forests and public lands, we are forced to acknowledge the great danger they are in.

A #FBF in honor of National Park Week to my 2011 summit of Mt. Rainier! Mt. Rainier National Park is an icon of the Pacific Northwest and a defining symbol of Washington State. Many generations of Americans have raised their families enjoying all it has to offer. I was proud to have secured funding for its expansion in 2007 to ensure many more generations will be able to take part in its beauty.

On Earth Day, while we think about the health of planet Earth, we must not forget the vital role that science and research play in protecting it. I believe that investing in basic scientific research should be the cornerstone of our country's strategy for combating climate change – the single greatest threat to our planet. I have worked hard to protect our environment because our world depends on healthy air and water, and protecting them is an utmost priority for me. I will keep fighting to craft responsible, effective, and bipartisan solutions to our nation’s energy and climate challenges.

I took the Senate floor today because I hope that future generations will be able to thank us for the protection of Bears Ears and all the national monument designations over the last two decades, including the beautiful San Juan Islands and Hanford Reach National Monuments in Washington state.   The Trump Administration is pushing for policies that are harmful to our $887 billion recreation economy, a disaster for our pristine places and set a terrible precedent for future conservation efforts. Share this and join me as I fight them every step of the way.

The Republican health care plan failed. The Affordable Care Act has not. It has succeeded in providing Washingtonians – and 20 million Americans across the country – with affordable coverage. Let’s stop efforts to unravel the ACA, work together to improve this law and lower the cost of health care for all Americans.

Washington has the nation’s highest state minimum wage at $11.00 and is one of the fastest growing economies in the country. Our state is proof we can grow our economy and provide Americans a living wage. It’s time for Congress to raise the national minimum wage and put workers before corporations. I’m proud to join Senator Sanders and Senator Murray in being a voice for working families.
Happy to kick-off of the People’s Climate March and call on President Trump to take bold climate action now! Thank you to everyone marching today for making your voices heard!

Today marks President Trump’s 100th day in office. His policies and proposals including irresponsible executive orders and proposed budget are poised to wreak havoc on Washington families and have serious consequences for hard working Americans. We must keep fighting.

Today we fought to make a point to President Trump. After decades of making progress on more fuel efficient airplanes, higher mileage per gallon standards for automobiles, and millions of new renewable energy jobs in biofuels, solar and wind – this Administration is trying to roll back policies that are going to save our planet. We must innovate our way out of this problem for a cleaner, greener planet and to create millions of jobs in the United States.

I had a great time talking to Bill Nye The Science Guy and the Union of Concerned Scientists! We share the hope that—as we move forward—the American people will continue to speak out against the policies of this administration that come into conflict with science. Especially science that goes into assessing the speed and intensity with which climate change is occurring. Science rules!

May Day reminds Americans that we must continue to be a leader in protecting equal rights & demanding dignity for all. We must make clear we welcome immigrants and refugees –  workers and families who contribute to the prosperity of our nation. We cannot roll back progress and accept discriminatory actions or falsehoods that run contrary to our values. We demand better from this President.

Decades of progress on women’s health and rights are under attack. The current anti-women climate has taken even standard Republican policies to a new and devastating extreme. We witnessed millions worldwide rise to demand that the lives of women and working families be put ahead of ideological and partisan attacks. I joined 31 Democratic Senators today to ensure this groundswell is not ignored.

I will never stop fighting for measures to expand America’s nondiscrimination protections. Which is why I joined Senate Democrats in reintroducing historic, comprehensive federal legislation to ban discrimination against LGBTQ Americans. The Equality Act of 2017 is needed to ensure full federal non-discrimination equality – since it’s 2017 and many states still don’t have explicit LGBTQ non-discrimination protection laws.   From Stonewall to marriage equality, the LGBTQ community has made tremendous advances in the struggle for equality. Together, we must continue the march towards full equality.

The Republican AHCA is a war on Medicaid, one the American people cannot afford. Medicaid has allowed communities that expanded coverage through the Affordable Care Act to improve the health of their communities, and support their local economies. Having more people with health care coverage in our communities has helped us raise the standard of living. I hope my colleagues in the Senate won't fall for this ploy – or go back on promises made by this Administration not to cut Medicaid. We have not forgotten.

Amy and Julie are two strong women on the frontlines of the healthcare battle. It was an honor to be with them today as we fight to protect the ACA and the millions of Americans who have gained coverage because of it.  Diagnosed with multiple cancers due to a genetic illness, Julie advocates as a patient – for patients with pre-existing condition, terrified they may lose their coverage. “The ACA literally saved my life and it is crucial to our healthcare system. No one should be in the position of bankrupting their family or dying, and that’s what the Republican house bill would do.”   With a story equally as powerful echoing just how severe the need is for access to basic care, Amy left us with an irrefutable call to action. “Please fight to keep the ACA from being repealed, because we are all worth it.”  Their fight, is our fight.

During his confirmation hearing, Secretary Zinke told us he wanted to be a Teddy Roosevelt-type of Interior Secretary. Yet this week he visits Utah to discuss the future of Bears Ears National Monument with politicians who seek to dismantle this incredible victory for our public lands.     Responsible for the stewardship of public lands and natural resources and making sure the interests of all American consumers and tribes are protected – Ryan Zinke should be leading our fight to keep public lands in public hands, not undermining it.

I spoke with Erin Burnett OutFront on CNN after shocking news yesterday that FBI Director James Comey was fired. People want to know, was this because he was closing in on information that might have incriminated people within the Trump Administration?   We need an independent special prosecutor to get the answers the American people deserve and demand accountability.

It’s time for Republicans to come to the table. The recent AHCA House bill was not only passed without a CBO score, but would eliminate hundreds of billions from state Medicaid programs, while diminishing consumer protections for those with pre-existing conditions, women, and more.   Republicans must stop these repeal efforts, and work with us to develop legislation that will improve quality, lower costs, and expand coverage for all Americans.

TUNE IN NOW: I’m fight to protect Bristol Bay and the 22,000 American jobs that depend on it. President Trump is making the appalling choice to put foreign mining company jobs over American fishing jobs.

Clearly, Attorney General Sessions had an active role in the termination of Director Comey. We need answers on if his involvement violated his recusal from the FBI Russia investigation.   It is imperative that the American people have faith in the institutions investigating any influence a hostile foreign power may have had on our presidential campaign, election, and the current administration of President Trump.

SeaTac Airport is an International transportation hub setting records each year for passenger growth. It’s critical the commitments made by TSA to reduce wait times at security checkpoints while maintaining traveler safety are fulfilled. Washington state depends on the efficient movement of goods and people to maintain strong economic growth and drive job creation.

By proposing to roll back strong net neutrality protections, President Trump’s Federal Communications Commission is threatening our open internet and the more than three million jobs that depend on it. Join me in sending a clear message to the FCC: access to internet economy must be free and open to all.

President Trump’s budget proposal does not put forward reasonable solutions to skyrocketing housing costs, Puget Sound clean-up, congested transportation infrastructure, and rising medical costs. And the lack of resources dedicated to Western priorities such as salmon conservation, critical agricultural assistance for farmers and ranchers, Land and Water Conservation Fund, and wildfire prevention demonstrates a clear lack of understanding of the economic and environmental issues that affect Western states. See below for my full statement following today’s release of the Trump Administration’s reckless budget proposal.

I spoke today to stand up for 1.7M Washingtonians, including 677,000 children and all Americans who rely on Medicaid to access health care, and who will suffer from draconian cuts in Trump's proposed budget.

The CBO score is out on the House health bill and millions of Americans will be left with nothing. This is not the way to treat children, veterans, and the elderly. I urge my Senate colleagues to drop repeal and stop trying to salvage an unworkable bill. Instead, let’s work together on innovative solutions to drive down costs and improve access, such as the Basic Health Program and community-based long term care.

We must uphold our trust and treaty obligations to tribal communities. President Trump’s budget attacks the very programs so critical to Indian Country. This reckless budget cannot be allowed to become law. I intend to fight for a budget that moves every corner of our country forward.

On Memorial Day, we express our profound gratitude for the men and women who died honorably fighting for our country, our veterans and those currently serving in our Armed Forces. In Washington state we are especially grateful to the many service members at out military bases who defend our freedom and protect our liberty.  It is more important than ever that we remember our duty to vigilantly ensure every veteran gets the care they need and deserve. It is because of their bravery and selfless service that we have a future of opportunity, strength and promise. We owe our soldiers and their families nothing less in return.

As we reach the end of Asian Pacific American Heritage Month we pledge to continue to honor the rich history, culture and traditions of Asians and Pacific Americans. For generations, Asian and Pacific American communities have contributed significantly to the cultural vibrancy of Washington State. I will continue to stand up for our Asian and Pacific American communities, and together remember the lessons of the past and increase the opportunities of the future.

This is a sad day for America. Donald Trump just quit the race to become the world's clean energy superpower and greatly diminished us in the eyes of our allies.   It now falls to our states and local communities to redouble our efforts to reduce emissions and find innovative ways to fight climate change. We all must show leadership now because our current President won't.

I believe American consumers who will be most affected by this merger are entitled to full explication of this merger in an open setting where its public interest value can be fully aired, examined and debated.
We must do everything we can to protect our oceans, fishing habitats and fishery jobs from ocean acidification. There are already worrying signs of damage.

We don’t want the Russian government influencing our elections or our democracy and we don’t want the current FBI investigation into Russian interference to be obstructed.   It looks from today’s testimony that President Trump attempted to influence Mr. Comey to drop the investigation into Michael Flynn or to move off of it, and to try to claim some sort of loyalty to the President, and purportedly fired Comey because of how he handled the Russian investigation.   We have to make sure that the White House is not trying to obstruct the investigation.   No one is above the law, not even the president.

Designated 17 years ago today, the Hanford Reach National Monument spans 51-miles of the free-flowing Columbia River. It is an iconic natural resource with areas for hiking, boating, fishing and hunting, while providing protection for rare habitat, and securing valuable salmon spawning grounds today and into the future. I will strongly oppose any attempt by the Trump Administration to modify Hanford Reach, or any of our nation’s cherished National Monuments.

HHS Secretary Tom Price, M.D. refused to say yes when asked if birth control should be part of basic health offered in employer-sponsored insurance plans. This is a very big problem. Women cannot be discriminated against by employers want to cherry-pick various aspects of women’s health to cover.

Making investments to make our electricity grid and our buildings smarter and more secure will grow the jobs our energy-efficient future demands. But to build more secure, efficient energy infrastructure we must skill and train Americans in these professions today. Senator Murkowski and I joined energy efficiency industry leaders in Seattle to discuss the investments needed to protect our nation’s energy grid more, secure and support energy efficient building technologies.
NA
I'm joining Senate Democratic women live talk about how disastrous Trumpcare would be for women & families.

Today, a report led by the AARP Foundation ranked Washington state #1 in the nation in the delivery of long-term health care, services, and supports to seniors and the disabled.  Washington scored high in measures of affordability, access, choice of setting, quality of life, and quality of care.    Washington's successful efforts to "rebalance" individuals from nursing homes to home-and-community-based care are a model for other states and represent true, innovative health reform to drive down costs rather than cutting and capping healthcare and kicking off people from coverage.
We are seeing deserved justice for our Native American communities and the environment with this ruling. Now it’s time to ensure that treaty rights are protected and all voices are heard.

The numbers don’t lie. Cutting Medicaid breaks our promise to America’s veterans. In Vancouver, this weekend I joined local providers, patient and veterans’ advocates, and a veteran Medicaid recipient to call on the administration and Senate Republicans to abandon their damaging and draconian cuts to the Medicaid program that will hurt our veterans, children and seniors.

Tonight I joined my fellow Democrats on the Senate floor to say we will not let a bill that was drafted in the darkness and cuts Medicaid coverage for millions of Americans get rammed through the Senate without putting up a fight. I urge my Republican colleagues to come out of the darkness and on to the floor to give us their ideas to increase access to health care, lower costs, and deliver better care to our constituents.

On MSNBC today I continued my call to Senate Republicans: If you think you have better ideas on health care, regardless of what’s in your bill, come discuss them. Come have the debate right now and we’ll debate you. This is not about secrets, this is about a health care policy that will affect millions of Americans and affect our economy, and we better get it right.

The Republican House bill was a mean bill. The President said so himself. And so, if the bill being drafted by Senate Republicans behind closed doors is 80% of the disastrous House bill, I guarantee you it's still going to be mean. And I guarantee you, we will fight this.

The Senate Republican’s Healthcare Bill is a hoax and a scheme. It’s not cost-effective for the American people and literally cuts people off from accessing health care. If the House bill was mean, this is doubling down on mean. I will fight against this cruel bill and fight for the millions of Americans who would suffer.
Senator Cantwell is live at Virginia Mason Hospital talking about the mean, reckless Republican health care plan.

I hope everyone across Washinton state is enjoying a happy and safe Pride weekend. I am proud to fight every day for measures to end discrimination & expand protections for all as we continue the march towards full equality.

I’ve been traveling across Washington state to discuss the impacts that steep cuts to Medicaid and access to health care in the Republican health care bill – unveiled only 4 days ago – will have on doctors, patients, veterans and families. I hope you join me and use every tool you have to help stop this disastrous Republican health care plan.

The Senate Trumpcare bill doubles down on mean. The bill will tear health insurance away from 15 million Medicaid patients while handing out tax cuts to the wealthiest. The Republican Trumpcare bill will also have devastating effects by raising costs and leaving more than 22 million Americans without health coverage overall. I will continue to fight the bill now – and at every opportunity.

Your e-mails, phone calls, storytelling, letters – your resistance – are working. We cannot pass this disastrous Republican healthcare plan – not now, not ever.   The fight is not over yet. The health care of more than 22 million Americans, and the very core of our health care safety net, is still at risk.   We must keep up the fight. Like and share if you are with me.

I am going to keep fighting this disastrous health care plan until Republicans drop their War on Medicaid and come to the table and discuss real solutions to improve care. As long as Republicans continue to talk about capping and cutting Medicaid – breaking the promise of President Trump – the health care of millions of Americans is still at risk.

I’m excited to announce I will be holding three town halls in Western Washington on topics important to Washingtonians and our state. I hope you will join me! Stay tuned for more town halls in the future!   For ticket information and to register for a town hall visit: https://www.cantwell.senate.gov/townhalls

Wishing everyone a Happy 4th of July! Thank you to the brave men and women serving in our military, and our veterans before them, your sacrifices protect this great nation and the hard-fought freedoms we cherish.

Don’t forget tomorrow I am holding a Health Care Town Hall to answer your health care questions and concerns. As I continue to fight to protect health care for Washingtonians, I want to hear what matters most to your family and community.   For more information and to register for the town hall visit: https://www.cantwell.senate.gov/townhalls
NA

I’m fighting hard to protect Net Neutrality because everyone deserves equal access to a free and open Internet – not just those who can afford to pay for special access.   Join me tomorrow for a Net Neutrality Town Hall to learn about what I’m doing to protect open Internet, and to discuss why it’s so important to our nation’s economy, innovators, entrepreneurs, and consumers.  Tickets are free and required to attend. To get your ticket visit: https://www.cantwell.senate.gov/townhalls
A free and open Internet is critical to our economy and consumers. Join us live at our town hall on the importance of net neutrality.

You’re invited to join me tomorrow for a town hall at TEC High School in White Center. I’m looking forward to hearing your questions and concerns on issues critical to Washington state and discussing my work fighting for Washingtonians in Congress.    Tickets are still available here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/town-hall-tickets-35827014565   Please pass along this invitation to others who may be interested in attending!   Reminder: Tickets are required to attend, and please leave large bags & backpacks at home.

I am excited to announce I'll be holding my next town halls in Wenatchee & Spokane, Washington in August. I look forward to hearing your questions, concerns and how I can best fight for the state of Washington.   Information on dates, times and how to register coming soon. Follow me on Twitter @SenatorCantwell, and check my website Cantwell.senate.gov for updates!

Thank you to everyone who attended a Cantwell Town Hall for your thoughtful questions, comments & concerns. I will take what I have heard this past week –  each story, hope, and concern for the future – and relay it to my colleagues across the aisle. I look forward to hearing from all Washingtonians in more town halls to come. Keep making your voices heard.

The disturbing reports from this weekend indicate that our adversaries are trying to take advantage of the very real vulnerabilities of our energy infrastructure’s cyber defenses.   I’m calling for President Trump to immediately perform the long overdue assessment of cyber vulnerabilities, and abandon his proposed cuts to the U.S. Department of Energy's Office tasked with protecting our energy networks from cyber-attacks. I am continuing to work with Senator Murkowski on our comprehensive energy bill to address U.S. cyber security challenges.

The Antiquities Act has successfully protected our nation’s scenic & historic beauty for all Americans to enjoy. Today I joined colleagues and advocates to strongly object to unlawful attacks by the Trump Administration on our National Monuments.

Today is the Net Neutrality Internet Day of Action! We must protect our free & open internet for the consumer, businesses, and jobs that rely on it. We must save the internet as we know it. Visit my website to learn more.

Now that Secretary Zinke agrees that the protection for the Hanford Reach National Monument should not be changed, the Trump Administration should abandon this review and the ill-advised effort to undermine national monuments altogether.   I reminded Secretary Zinke that President Trump does not have the authority to rescind the lawful status of our protected national monuments in the first place and taxpayer dollars should have never been used for the Trump administration’s unlawful attack on the Antiquities Act.

In one fell swoop, President Trump and his anti-science EPA administrator are threatening our salmon, our environment, and our jobs: We must protect Bristol Bay and the thousands of jobs that depend on it.

The newest health care bill released today by Senate Republicans is still mean, and it’s still a War on Medicaid. Even worse, it now includes a provision that would allow insurers to sell Americans junk insurance plans that limit or deny coverage of essential benefits including hospitalization, maternity care, preventive care,  prescription drugs, and substance abuse treatment. Under this provision, as long as insurers offered at least one comprehensive insurance plan, they could also offer a bunch of plans that – based on CBO’s definition – aren't even health insurance. I strongly urge my colleagues to reject this mean bill.

For years, same-sex married couples had been paying more in taxes simply because of who they love. The Refund Equality Act will correct this injustice and give same-sex couples the fair treatment on their tax bill they should have received years ago.

Everyone should have health care and it should be universal. Senate Republicans must stop this War on Medicaid and work with us to improve affordability in the individual market. Today, I provided some of my own solutions.

Thanks to the of promises made by past presidents – from Teddy Roosevelt to Barack Obama – to protect our public lands, we today have treasured outdoor spaces that are part of a huge economy and are a valued possession for the American public to enjoy.

This fight isn’t over. The issue of how to provide health care to Americans must be a discussion between Republicans AND Democrats. We have to keep fighting because we are not going to kick people off their health care in an attempt to cut costs – it won’t work.

Disappointed, but not surprised, that the House Republican budget includes a proposal to drill in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge.   We have seen this story before — every Republican Administration and every Republican-majority Congress has tried to turn over this iconic national wildlife refuge to the oil and gas industry.   We need to protect the Arctic Refuge, not raid it for oil.

Great progress for women & girls in STEM! We must continue investing in computer science education to equip future innovators with the skills to compete in a global economy and diversify our tech workforce.

Great news! Both of these grants will help ensure underserved communities have access to local outdoor recreation opportunities.   Not only will these park improvements help people get outside, but they will provide an economic boost for these communities by supporting jobs and attracting new business.

Today, I joined U.S. Senate Democrats to unveil A Better Deal. An economic plan for the future with three goals: raise wages & create jobs, lower costs of living and build a 21st Century economy. Americans face a growing lack of affordability and pressure from all sides – they deserve A Better Deal.

I say this to my Republican colleagues: don't play politics with health care. Taking a vote on politics, when lives  and the health care access that so many millions of Americans depend on is at stake, is wrong. Let's find a solution that works on both sides of the aisle and most importantly, works for the American people.

Since January, I have been repeating the same message to my Republican colleagues: don’t kick millions of Americans off of health care and instead come work with us to fix the individual market and improve the Affordable Care Act.   Today’s motion to proceed formally declares a war on Medicaid, and is a key step in taking health care away from millions of Americans.   I will continue to use every tool at my disposal to protect health care for Washingtonians and all Americans.

Transgender service members are honorable and patriotic. They, and all Americans protecting the freedoms and values we hold dear, must receive our utmost respect and dignity. Discrimination in any form is unacceptable.  We must defeat this discriminatory policy.

Tonight, the voices of millions of Americans were heard. Your stories, your phone calls, your emails, your advocacy, and all of your hard work paid off. Tonight, we were able to protect Medicaid, protect the Affordable Care Act, and preserve coverage for millions of Americans.   Now we must chart a path to progress.  We need to find bipartisan solutions, particularly in the individual health insurance market, to drive down costs, increase access, and innovate in the health care delivery system.

Over the past four decades, the number of families paying unaffordable rents in America has doubled. By 2025, it is estimated that as many as 15 million Americans will spend half their monthly income on rent, an increase of 25 percent. We must address America’s affordable housing crisis and invest in proven solutions like the Low-Income Housing Tax Credit.

Our seniors should not have to choose between life-saving medicine and other vital necessities. I’m proud to join my colleagues in introducing legislation allowing Medicare to leverage its purchasing power to lower prescription drug prices for seniors. When you buy in bulk, you should get a discount. Along with legislation I’ve cosponsored allowing the importation of safe, low-cost medicine from Canada, these bills can help to bring down the rising costs of prescription drugs.

As of today, 50% more acres have already burned this year than normal and yesterday a forecast report predicted the west is likely to experience above normal wildfires over the next month.   This is why we should combine real-time fire mapping and GPS locating technologies to give our firefighters more safety and security as they deal with these unbelievable conditions.

Today, we celebrate and thank the U.S. Coast Guard for 227 years of service, and the brave Coast Guard men and women stationed around the globe. Eighty-eight thousand men and women - active duty, reserve, civilian, and auxiliary - proudly serve in critical jobs afloat, ashore, and in the air to protect our maritime interests and national security. Happy Birthday U.S. Coast Guard!

Proud to announce a major win for Washington Crab Fishermen with the Senate passage of my legislation to preserve the sustainable management our Dungeness crab fisheries for many years to come. Washington state’s Dungeness crab fishery is an economic pillar of our coastal communities, supporting thousands of fishing and processing jobs.

I’m excited to announce I’m holding my next two town halls in Wenatchee and Spokane, Washington to discuss my work in the Senate to serve Washington state, listen to the concerns of my constituents and answer questions on issues important to Washingtonians. I hope you will join me!  For more information & to register for a town hall visit: https://www.cantwell.senate.gov/townhalls  #CantwellTownHall

Science has to trump politics when it comes to the health and safety of our citizens.   President Trump and his cabinet must stop their war on science and heed the warnings of some of our country’s top minds who are urging us to take immediate action to combat climate change. Senator Collins and I are looking forward to receiving the GAO report we requested on this topic and will be discussing a legislative response based on the facts.

The Interior Department admits it is giving away up to $750 million over a decade to oil, gas and coal companies making profits on a public resource.   Suspending this rule was not lawful in the first place, and this repeal violates Interior’s obligation to ensure a fair return to taxpayers.
I'm here at Wenatchee High School discussing issues important to our state and Central Washingtonians. Join me live for my Wenatchee town hall. #CantwellTownHall

I’m excited to be in Spokane, Washington at Gonzaga University for a town hall to hear from Eastern Washingtonians and discuss the issues important to Washington state. Join me live to listen in! #CantwellTownHall

In light of the horrific attack and hatred demonstrated in Charlottesville, 11 of my Senate colleagues and I urge Attorney General Jeff Sessions to act quickly to address the alarming rise of hate in our country.   President Trump’s reluctance to quickly and directly condemn the hate, bigotry, and racism of the white supremacists and members of the Ku Klux Klan that gathered at Charlottesville was deeply alarming to us and to millions of Americans.

I’m proud to have helped secure the $45 million from the FASTLANE grant program which I championed in the FAST Act in 2015. I will continue fighting to fix our infrastructure to build strong economic growth and make our country more economically competitive. Washington state loses millions of dollars in economic activity because of train, truck, and urban traffic congestion –at Lander Street alone. By moving freight faster, we can fuel our export economy and create good paying jobs.

I'm excited to join the Makah Tribe to celebrate the arrival of new high-speed broadband internet service coming to Neah Bay, Washingon for the first time.  I'm proud to have worked with the Makah Tribe and CenturyLink to make High-speed internet a reality. Expanding broadband access is critical to expanding opportunity in job growth, economic development, health services and education.
Makah Broadband Celebration Ribbon Cutting Ceremony

We are grateful to former Senator Dan Evans for his dedication to preserving our wilderness and most treasured places. Naming the Olympic Wilderness in his honor is a deserved recognition of his many years of work to protect Washington’s national parks and forests.

Secretary Zinke’s secret report to the President is the latest step in a rigged process to try and turn over our public lands to oil and gas companies. The Trump Administration is trying to erase over 100 years of conservation and open space for all to enjoy through hunting, fishing and recreating.   Any attempt to eliminate outdoor recreation opportunities for veterans and all other Americans by giving them away to special interests is unacceptable. These special places belong to the people, not to corporate polluters, and I will continue fighting to keep them that way.

Today we thank and celebrate the National Park Service for 101 years of conservation and stewardship of our treasured parks and forests. In Washington state, our national parks and outdoor recreation are not only a key part of our economy, but allow us to be the hikers, bikers, anglers, climbers, skiers and outdoor enthusiasts we are today. It has never been more important that we fight to protect America’s national parks, forests and public lands to preserve them for the generations to come. #NPS101 #FindYourPark

Proud of our Coast Guard men & women, local first responders and so many from Washington state working to aid Hurricane Harvey disaster relief efforts. We stand with Texas, Louisiana, and all those who have been affected by this tragedy.

Wild Pacific salmon are central to our economy, our culture, and our environment in the Pacific Northwest. The released Atlantic farmed salmon pose a threat to wild Pacific salmon. I’ve called on NOAA and the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers to immediately act to minimize the impact of the farmed salmon net pen failure on our wild Pacific salmon.

Broadband is a necessity. Without it, our rural communities can’t take advantage of the opportunities presented by our increasingly connected economy, kids can’t access high-speed internet to do their homework and entrepreneurs are unable to start online businesses. I'm proud to have worked with CenturyLink and the Makah Tribe, to secure broadband in Neah Bay that will support local families and the economy.

Labor Day is a reminder that we must continue to fight for the American worker. We must ensure that American workers are not left behind but are rather leading us into the future. They are the backbone of the American economy and the American spirit. In so many ways, workers are what make the opportunity and prosperity of our great state and country a reality. Today and every day we celebrate the contributions of labor, workers, and their families to our country. Happy Labor Day!

I am profoundly disappointed in President Trump’s decision to repeal DACA. I’ve joined my colleagues in urging him to reconsider, and demanding he urge his Republican colleagues to work with Congress on bipartisan legislation that will provide protection to Dreamers.   Elimination of this critical program will cost Washington state an estimated $1.1 billion in annual GDP. Nationally, the cruel end of this program will cost $460.3 billion in GDP over the next 10 years.   Our state has long served as a leader in welcoming and protecting immigrants. Our economy and society are better for Washington state’s determination to create an inclusive society. It is clear that ending this program is an unconscionable mistake.  Read my full letter to President Trump: https://www.cantwell.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/WA%20Delegation_POTUS_DACA_Letter_09_05_2017.pdf

The president's decision to end DACA runs counter to the long-standing and proud history in our state welcoming immigrants. It is simple: you either want to protect these young individuals or you don't.

Sixteen years after the horrific attacks of September 11th, the wounds are still healing. Today we honor the thousands of innocent lives lost, and extend our deepest sympathies to their families and loved ones.   As we pause to reflect, we are reminded of the strength and resilience of this nation by the tremendous heroism of first responders and everyday Americans. We pay our deepest gratitude to the men and women who serve this nation for their bravery on September 11th, and for protecting our freedom and communities every day.

There are serious questions that need to be answered about the treatment of public servants who have dedicated their careers to the Department of the Interior.   Any suggestion that the Department is reassigning senior employees to force them to resign, to silence their voices, or to punish them for the conscientious performance of their public duties is extremely troubling and calls for the closest examination.

President Trump’s reluctance to quickly and directly condemn the hate, bigotry, and racism of the white supremacists and members of the Ku Klux Klan that gathered at Charlottesville was deeply alarming to me and to millions of Americans. Following these horrific events, I sent a letter with eleven Democratic senators to Attorney General Jeff Session calling on him to create a federal task force to stop hate crimes. We must act quickly to address the alarming rise of hate in our country.

Phone service, broadband, and TV access are critical to saving lives and protecting property when disaster strikes. As extreme weather events like wildfires and hurricanes become more severe, communities across our country will rely more on these communications systems. The SANDy Act paves the way for communities to restore communications and respond more quickly, regardless of what Mother Nature throws at them.

If this report is true it makes even clearer that Secretary Zinke and the Trump Administration are trying to erase over 100 years of conservation and open space for all to enjoy through hunting, fishing and recreating. These special places belong to the American people, not to corporate polluters, and I will continue fighting to keep them that way. Any attempt to eliminate outdoor recreation opportunities for veterans and all Americans by giving them away to special interests is unacceptable.

Republicans’ newest Trumpcare bill is just one more sneak attack by our colleagues at kicking people off of Medicaid. There is nothing good about cutting health coverage and kicking 15 million people off of Medicaid. It's important that we get this right. The health care of Americans is too important.

In the wake of historic wildfires in Washington and across the West, today a bipartisan group of senators and I introduced the Wildfire Disaster Funding Act of 2017 that will stop the fire-borrowing that is currently crippling our Forest Service, protect desperately needed funding for fire prevention and treat wildfires as the natural disasters they are.  Read more about our bill here: https://sen.gov/cantwell/WJOQ
NA

As the future of DACA hangs in the balance – so do the lives of 800,000 young people brought to the U.S. as children known as Dreamers. Today, Patty Murray, Rep. Adam Smith,Congresswoman Pramila Jayapal, and I stand with Dreamers and call on Republicans to work with us, make the DACA program permanent and put an end to this uncertainty.

Sounding the alarm with patients, doctors & health leaders in my state over Republican’s latest health care sneak attack to kick millions off of Medicaid. American’s deserve better than the severe harm this new Trumpcare bill would have on children and families across our country.

Republicans newest version of Trumpcare – the Graham Cassidy bill – would cut Medicaid, a lifeline for children with special needs, complex health conditions, and rare diseases. I'm very concerned about the millions of children in WA state and nationwide, who'd be hurt by no longer having access to affordable health care. We need to stop this bill and move on to health care solutions that will help us create better, more affordable care – not kick millions off it.

Bottom line: The Graham Cassidy bill kicks millions of Americans off of Medicaid, won't make us healthier or give our health care system the affordability we all want to see. Nobody should think this is a good idea.

Secretary Zinke’s comments yesterday betray a fundamental misunderstanding of the role of federal civil service. Public servants at the Department of the Interior are non-political employees charged with implementing and enforcing laws passed by Congress and have incredible domain expertise in their areas of responsibility.   Replacing them with purely political people will not protect our public lands or protect taxpayers from special interest sweetheart deals.

I’m glad this misguided effort was successfully stalled.  It has been wrongheaded to try to stabilize the individual market by destabilizing Medicaid. We must now focus on solutions for affordability and access by innovating in the delivery of health care.

Don’t want internet companies to charge you more for an internet “fast lane?” FCC Chairman Ajit Pai has made it clear that he wants to rewrite our net neutrality rules – to do just that.   I will be opposing Pai’s nomination because a strong and open internet is key to an economy of the future. Like and share if you support net neutrality and an open and free internet!

I've expressed to President Trump my deep concern for the dire humanitarian situation in Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. In the words of Governor Ricardo Rosselló, the people of Puerto Rico have been “essentially devastated." The United States Virgin Islands has also suffered catastrophic damage.  There is not a second to lose. The health and well-being of millions of Americans in the U.S. territories depend on swift action.
Using taxpayer money to charter a private flight on an oil executive’s plane is not how the Secretary of the Interior should do business. The taxpayers need answers.

Protecting iconic public lands across the United States is essential to preserving our natural, cultural, historical, and scientific value for the benefit of all Americans and future generations. We cannot let this administration turn over our public lands, national monuments, parks and forests to oil and gas companies. Any attempt to eliminate outdoor recreation opportunities for veterans and all other Americans by giving them away to special interests is unacceptable. Like and share to celebrate & give thanks to America’s protected public lands that give us so much in return! Happy National Public Lands Day!

With another Republican Congress comes another attempt to turn over this iconic national wildlife refuge to the oil and gas industry. Fortunately, all previous attempts to destroy this pristine Arctic ecosystem have failed and I’m going to fight tooth and nail until this attempt fails too.
Ajit Pai wants to go against more than 22 million American consumers and innovators who have told him to keep the internet free and open, by repealing our robust net neutrality rules. I vote no.
I look forward to reviewing the Inspector General's report and if it concludes that Secretary Zinke misused public funds, he should promptly reimburse the taxpayers.
The Republican sneak attack to cut people off health care continues...  Their budget cuts Medicare by $473 billion and Medicaid by more than $1 trillion.

I’ve cosponsored a bill that would ban the sale, transfer, importation, manufacture or possession of bump stocks devices like those used in the horrific Las Vegas mass shooting. We must close this loophole that allows the sale of devices to convert guns into unlawful automatic weapons meant for war zones.

Joining fellow members of Congress, outdoor enthusiasts & advocates to call for the permanent reauthorization of the Land and Water Conservation Fund. LWCF is one of our nation’s oldest and most successful conservation programs!

Destroying a national wildlife refuge is not the answer to our nation’s energy problems. Fortunately, all previous attempts to destroy this pristine Arctic ecosystem have failed and I’m going to fight tooth and nail until this attempt fails too.

Women cannot be discriminated against by employers who want to cherry-pick essential benefits. Today’s rule continues this Administration’s troubling rollback of women’s health and rights. I will continue working with my colleagues to safeguard access to vital preventive health care, including birth control.

Yet another irresponsible retreat from making polluters pay, promoting energy efficiency, growing our clean energy economy, addressing the threat of climate change and ensuring taxpayers get a fair return for the minerals they own. We must use every tool at our disposal to prevent this Administration from sabotaging the United States’ chances of becoming the world’s clean energy superpower.

THIS IS IMPORTANT: The EPA recently announced plans to reverse clean water safeguards paving the way for a large-scale Canadian Pebble Mine being proposed at the headwaters of the Bristol Bay watershed that would threaten the entire region. The Pebble Mine would threaten Bristol Bay salmon, Pacific Northwest jobs and the multi-billion dollar economy Bristol Bay supports.   Today I urged President Trump to listen to our fishermen and businesses before removing science-based environmental rules that protect Bristol Bay. The future of Bristol Bay must be determined by science, not politics.

President Trump’s action would allow employers to discriminate against women by cherry-picking coverage for essential benefits.  As this Administration continues its troubling rollback of women’s health and rights, I will continue working with my colleagues to safeguard access to vital preventive health care, including birth control.

President Trump should not try to open the door to junk insurance. Cutting essential benefits out of health insurance puts patients at risk of having no coverage for basics like hospitalizations and prescription drugs.   The President should instead work across the aisle to drive down costs and increase access through state bundling options – like Basic Health Plans – and delivery system reforms.

President Trump is doubling down on throwing health insurance markets into chaos. This action will threaten health insurance for millions of Americans, including those receiving comprehensive care at low cost through state Basic Health Plans. I remain committed to enacting bipartisan policies to drive down costs as we have done for years in Washington state – but this action takes us in the opposite direction.
President Trump’s actions will throw our health insurance markets into chaos. I will fight this attack on the health care of millions of Americans.

Every Republican Administration and Republican Congress has tried to open up drilling in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge to the oil and gas industry. It is disappointing – but not surprising they’re trying again. We must stop them and protect the Arctic Refuge, not raid it for oil.

I rise to strongly oppose the GOP plan to open up our Arctic National Wildlife Refuge to oil drilling. I urge my colleagues to fight this attack on our nation’s most beautiful and pristine public lands.

Today I took the Senate floor to demand we have a tax discussion that is about a fair and open process and a continued dialogue about how to make sure that working families get a fair deal in a tax policy. State and local tax deductions have been an important way in which our taxpayers make sure they are treated fairly, and they must get to keep them.

I support the Murray/Alexander agreement which stops the President’s sabotage of the health care system. We need to enact a comprehensive affordability solution for the individual health insurance market, and the Murray/Alexander agreement helps us get there.
I’ve introduced a common-sense bill to better prepare for and prevent costly wildfires. It's time we reduce wildfire risk and help better protect our communities.

The chaos the Trump administration has caused means insurers are raising rates and thereby making insurance less affordable. We need to stop President Trump's sabotage and propose more affordable options in the individual market.

My colleagues no longer have to take it from me – the Government Accountability Office tells us climate change will cost taxpayers more than a half a trillion dollars this decade, and trillions more in the future unless we mitigate the impacts.

This year alone, the economic cost of climate change to the U.S. will exceed $300 billion. A GAO report tells us that by 2039, climate change will cost U.S. taxpayers more than $1 trillion. We must act now to mitigate the impacts of climate change.
While Secretary Zinke flies around on private jets using our taxpayer dollars, he is hiking up the fees all American families pay to enjoy our National Parks.

We are seeing the impacts of climate change and now thanks to the new GAO report I requested two years ago – we know what it’s costing us. It’s time to quit thinking about climate change in political terms and start thinking about it in fiscal terms or it will continue to cost our country billions of dollars each year.

It was wonderful to attend the Gold Medal Ceremony in honor of the Filipino Veterans of World War II today in our nation’s capital with so many Filipino-Americans from Washington state! I’m honored to continue to work with my colleagues to ensure Filipino veterans who served bravely in WWII receive the distinction and benefits they deserve.

I’ve joined Senator Ron Wyden to request a GAO investigation into the $300 million contract awarded to Whitefish Energy Holdings.
