Recent media reports in multiple publications have raised serious allegations of potentially inflated costs of time and material in the contract as well as the opaque & limited nature of the bidding process. It's essential that as we deliver resources to Puerto Rico we have confidence the funds are being spent wisely and cost-effectively.

It’s impossible to see how doubling or tripling an entrance fee to a park is anything other than an effort to exclude many Americans from enjoying their national parks. Today I told Secretary Zinke to provide Congress with the justification used to establish the proposed park entrance fee increases. National parks are for all Americans— not just the wealthy.

An investigation to determine how we got into this situation in the first place must continue. Taxpayers should pay a fair rate for the emergency repairs Puerto Rico desperately needs – not be gouged by Whitefish Energy or anyone else. I’m calling on the President and FEMA to ensure this cancellation results in no delay in restoring power to millions of American families in Puerto Rico.

Diana and her family, like so many Washingtonians are worried about a tax increase under the latest Republican tax plan proposing to eliminate state and local tax deductions. Together, in Renton this weekend, we called on Republicans to keep these deductions in their tax proposal and protect our tax fairness. We need tax reform that invests in our workers, provides relief to families and takes our innovation economy to the next level.

Republicans are pushing a tax plan that would limit 401k savings plans which would only make it harder for Americans to save for their future and for hardworking families to get ahead. We should be incentivizing Americans to save by investing in their 401k retirement savings plans – not limiting them.

As we discuss the future of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge let’s remember we set aside this pristine area for a very specific purpose: to conserve fish, wildlife, their habitats & natural diversity unlike anywhere else. The Arctic Refuge has been attacked many times – but none successfully, and we must keep it that way.

The affordable housing crisis impacts every state and every community, urban and rural alike. We know how to solve this crisis. We need to expand the Low Income Housing Tax Credit to build more affordable homes across the country & help devastated communities in Puerto Rico, Texas and Florida rebuild.

The Republican tax plan would raise taxes on many middle class families in Washington state by eliminating our ability to deduct local sales taxes and drastically limit the mortgage interest deduction, making it harder to buy and own a home.

The cost of climate change is staggering and projected to increase as extreme weather events, hurricanes and wildfires become more severe. We must act now the mitigate the impacts of climate change to protect lives and livelihoods across our country.  I joined Bill Loveless at the Columbia Energy Exchange to discuss why this isn’t about politics and what actions we need to take.
I'm calling on my Republican colleagues to address our affordable housing crisis by including the Low Income Housing Tax Credit expansion in their tax bill.

FYI: The GOP is out with a new plan to turn the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge into an oil field. We’re here to remind everyone why we set aside this pristine refuge in the first place & why we’ll never stop fighting to protect it!

Today on Veteran’s Day, we celebrate and pay tribute to those who have served bravely in the United States Armed Forces. We owe veterans our gratitude and respect for their exemplary service and commitment to protecting our great nation. Today I especially want to recognize the brave men and women from Washington state who volunteered their service and their lives to defend our freedom. We thank you today, and always.

A big chunk of this Republican tax plan would be paid for on the backs of middle-class families by taking away their tax deductions. This isn’t simplification of our tax code – it’s simply raising taxes on middle-class families in my state, and its raising taxes on millions of Americans across the United States to give tax breaks to corporations!

When we started this tax reform debate it was about how we were going to close corporate loopholes and make sure the tax bill paid for itself, NOT do it on the backs of my constituents and nearly 14 million across the country. Gouging middle-class families to pay for corporate tax breaks is just wrong.

This morning Senate Republicans are moving to push through legislation to open up the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge to drilling and turn this wildlife refuge into an oil field. The purpose of this refuge was to protect a precious Arctic ecosystem and wildlife that lives there, and it should remain a refuge. #ProtectTheArctic

Why is it the President of the United States deserves a $32 million dollar tax break and my constituent – a military veteran who is struggling with his wife to make ends meet is desperate to know if he will have to pay more taxes under the GOP tax plan?   Republicans need to stop trying to rush this dark-of-night tax bill that changes our tax codes in ways that we can’t even get answers on.

JOIN THE FIGHT: I’m here today with fellow outdoor enthusiasts, Washingtonians & small businesses to call on the Trump Administration and Secretary of Interior Ryan Zinke to withdraw the NPS proposal to nearly triple national park entrance fees. We demand all Americans have affordable access to their national parks!     LIKE, SHARE & COMMENT to help us fight the fee hike!     **Deadline to comment on the NPS proposed national park visitor fee increase is November 23, 2017 (Thanksgiving Day). Comments can be submitted on the NPS website.**

We recognize November as Native American Heritage Month to celebrate the heritages, cultures and cherished contributions of Native Americans to the United States of America. The important histories of Washington state’s Tribal nations have informed our Pacific Northwest identity instilling deep respect for their vibrant cultures, traditions and a deep-rooted sense of community. I am committed to strengthening and enriching our tribal communities as a member of the Senate Indian Affairs Committee, and proud Washingtonian.
Happy Thanksgiving! I wish you, friends, family, and loved ones a relaxing and joyful Thanksgiving holiday filled with cheer, gratitude & good food!

Small businesses drive our economy and help create jobs on Main Streets across America. Supporting local small businesses means investing in local jobs and the future success of our communities. On this Small Business Saturday, I encourage my fellow Washingtonians to visit the small, local shops in their neighborhoods!

At 6pm PT, I will be joining Senator Bernie Sanders on CNN to debate Senators Cruz and Scott on the GOP's dark of night tax plan. It is not right that the Republican tax plan pays for corporate handouts on the backs of middle-class families.

Thanks to those who tuned in to #CNNDebateNight. I'm going to continue to fight to protect the middle class. Join me by calling your member of Congress and stop this bill. Don't put a #Trumptax on the middle class. Let's get this right. It's about our future.

STAND WITH ME: The National Arctic Refuge is one of the most pristine places on the planet, and Republicans are hoping to give it away to Big Oil by sticking it in a dark-of-night tax bill they started less than a month ago. This is unacceptable.

Today, I launched a new Instagram page and my first post is about the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge because this wildlife refuge is too important and too pristine to let Republicans give it away to Big Oil.  https://www.instagram.com/senatormariacantwell/  Like and share to make your voice heard. The outdoor economy is our strongest economy. We need to stand for Americans having access to open space, to recreate, to participate, to hunt, and stand for the spiritual Gwich’in and indigenous people of our country.

I will be taking the Senate floor later this morning to fight for middle class families by proposing an amendment to the GOP tax plan that keeps the full state and local sales tax deduction for individual taxpayers. This bill is not helping the middle class and we need to change that.

Veterans, sportsmen, climbers, hikers and the outdoor economy all depend on open space.  Bears Ears and Grand Staircase-Escalante have been driving a vibrant outdoor economy for years. Now President Trump is using unlawful authority to pollute these special places. His administration deserves an F for stewardship.

It is just plain wrong that the GOP tax bill gives huge tax breaks to corporations and Wall Street while raising taxes on middle class families. We should have a tax code that boosts the middle class and grows the economy from the middle out. There’s still a chance to do a bipartisan tax reform bill so let's slow down and work together.

Have questions about signing up for coverage through the Affordable Care Act? Let health advocate and 4-time cancer survivor Julie Negrin help answer some of your questions to get you through the process. And don’t forget – Open Enrollment in Washington ends January 15, 2018 (and December 15, 2017 in most other states).

Joining Congresswoman Suzan DelBene and tech leaders to tell Federal Communications Commissioner Ajit Pai to do his job and drop his misguided attempt at repealing net neutrality rules. It critical to consumers, innovators and entrepreneurs that we keep the internet a free, open, and equal platform.

Weakening the internet economy will be particularly harmful to the economy of Washington state. The internet economy is responsible for 13% of our economic output. A quarter of a million jobs in Washington state depend on the continued good health and vibrancy of our internet economy.   We must protect net neutrality. We need an open internet.
Join me and FCC Commissioner Mignon Clyburn over on twitter at 11:00am PT/2:00pm ET for a #netneutrality town hall. We have to keep this conversation going and protect the open and free internet.
